verbose_text: CNO application increased the frequency and regularity of autonomous activity in hM3D (Gq)-mCherry-expressing STN neurons in slices from both 6-OHDA- and vehicle injected mice, presumably through the generation of a persistent inward current that could be measured under voltage clamp at -60 mV (XREF_FIG - XREF_FIG; XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY).
evidence: CNO application increased the frequency and regularity of autonomous activity in hM3D(Gq)-mCherry-expressing STN
